bib.title: Comparison of the efficiency of mapreduce and bulk synchronous parallel approaches to large network processing
bib.author: Kajdanowicz, Tomasz and Indyk, Wojciech and Kazienko, Przemyslaw and Kukul, Jakub
bib.abstract: Network structures, especially social networks, grow rapidly and provide huge datasets intractable to analyse. In this paper, two parallel approaches to process large graph structures within the Hadoop environment were compared: Bulk Synchronous Parallel (BSP) and MapReduce (MR). The experimental studies were carried out for two different graph problems: collective classification by means of Relational Influence Propagation (RIP) and Single Source Shortest Path (SSSP) calculation. The appropriate BSP and MapReduce
bib.booktitle: 2012 IEEE 12th International Conference on Data Mining Workshops
